results.title: An Eye for the job
results.creator_credit: Nigel Miller, Kevin Sim and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery”.
A documentary about the quiet revolution in the operating theatre. The surgeon has now harnessed his skills to the microscope, and operations of the most minute detail are achieved with microsurgery. Depicts five case studies - a blind painter is made to see again, a deaf grandmother can hear again, a worker’s torn off hand is restored, a man’s severed thumb is replaced by his big toe, and a young woman has her fallopian tubes untied.

results.title: An Eye for business
results.brief_description: Shows how ideas and design are converted into computer language and how the “light pen” has enabled the engineer or designer to communicate with a computer in his own terms-pictorially-by the technique of computer graphics.

results.title: An Everyday miracle
results.brief_description: Shows the use of ultrasound and microphotography to determine intra uterine health from conception to birth. Narrated by Sir David Attenborough, this documentary has incredible shots of the developing foetus.

results.title: An Enquiry into the American highway
results.creator_credit: Bert Kempers and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Altered Environment Series”.
Points out that there is enough sealed road surface in the United States to cover most of the New England area. Questions what effects highways have on the total environment, what alternatives there are, and how to choose the best ways to use the land.

results.title: An English village
results.brief_description: Harting, a pleasant village in the south of England, follows the traditional pattern of an English village as a neighbourly community in which people live, work, and enjoy their leisure together. In particular, the film illustrates the many communal activities, such as the Parish Council and the Women’s Institute, which play an important part in English village life.

results.title: An English county: Surrey
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A portrait of Surrey, showing towns, villages, hills and riversides, recalling places of historical association and familirar beauty spots, and revealing some lesser-known features of the county. Includes scenes of Box Hill, Leith Hill, Friday Street, Shere and Abinger Hammer.

results.title: An Engineered timber building
results.brief_description: This film shows how engineers exploited the versatility of timber in the design of a new laboratory for the CSIRO Division of Forest Products. Only the outer frame and curtain wall of the building are of concrete and brick; the rest of the two-storey building, including the framework, is of timber.

results.title: An Awful moment
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: A judge finds himself the object of a gypsy woman’s anger and revenge when he passes sentence on her husband. Cast includes George Gebhardt, Marion Leonard, Harry Solter, Florence Lawrence, Linda Arvidson, Mack Sennett. Silent film with musical soundtrack and English intertitles.

results.title: An Award for Mr. Rossi
results.brief_description: A satiric cartoon on the experimental film and its audience. Mr. Rossi buys a cine camera and sets out to make an oscar-winning film using his wife as the star. No other credits available.

results.title: An Attack on asthma
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the effects of asthma on the respiratory system and what is being done to find a cure and more effective techniques of treatment. The Asthma Foundation of Victoria’s role in helping the social and economic problems of asthma patients is outlined
